required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SoCal Savvy: Testing Savvy Caregiver in a Racially and Ethnically Diverse Sample in Southern California
clinical_study.official_title: SoCal Savvy: Testing Savvy Caregiver in a Racially and Ethnically Diverse Sample in

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will conduct a hybrid efficacy-effectiveness trial intended to address these gaps by testing the efficacy-effectiveness of two multi-family group interventions, and on 250 English-speaking adults: Savvy Caregiver Express™ (3-session, newly piloted in Los Angeles County for feasibility) and Savvy Caregiver Program (original 6-session evidenced-based intervention), across post-intervention, 3- and 6-months.

detailed_description.textblock:
A number of epidemiological studies, systematic reviews, and consensus reports highlight the importance of non-pharmacological, sociobehavioural interventions to address the health, psychological, and social effects of caregiving for persons living with dementia, and the need for tangible information and resources.
The investigators will conduct a hybrid efficacy-effectiveness trial intended to address these gaps by testing the efficacy-effectiveness of two multi-family group interventions, and on 250 English-speaking adults: Savvy Caregiver Express™ (3-session, newly piloted in Los Angeles County for feasibility) and Savvy Caregiver Program (original 6-session evidenced-based intervention), across post-intervention, 3- and 6-months. It is hypothesized that no differences (comparable effects) between the programs in their efficacy/effectiveness and moderating conditions.
Focus groups (~25 participants) will be conducted to ascertain program acceptability and satisfaction.
The analyses will include a multiple linear mixed-effects modeling for our trial outcomes, and thematic analyses for our focus group interview data.

study_design_info.masking_description: The outcome assessor will not have previous knowledge of the respondent's interventional group assignment.

primary_outcome.measure: Revised Memory and Behavior Problems Checklist (RMBPC)
primary_outcome.description: caregiver reactivity to family member's memory/behavior problems

secondary_outcome.description: measures caregiver skills, mastery, competence, management of the situation based on the Caregiver Competence, Management and Meaning Scales

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study Social Support Survey (MOS)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures caregiver social support using the MOS scale
TA one-item measure that assesses if the caregiver intends to institutionalize the family member in the next 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Family Members Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
secondary_outcome.description: measures family member's activities of daily living using the Katz ADL scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Family Members Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL)
secondary_outcome.description: measures family member's activities of daily living using the Lawton IDL scale

other_outcome.description: This is a measure developed for this specific study to ascertain the study participant's satisfaction with the intervention itself.

arm_group.description: Savvy Caregiver Program, 6 weekly sessions, group treatment, addressing educational, informational, and psychosocial issues and community resources.
Savvy Express, 3 weekly sessions, group treatment, addressing educational, informational, and psychosocial issues and community resources.

intervention.description: Informational and educational group-mediated program for family members caring for a person living with dementia; 6 sessions.
Informational and educational group-mediated program for family members caring for a person living with dementia; 3 sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- English- speaking women and men age 18 or older who care for or provide assistance to someone with dementia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Caregivers who have sensory or physical conditions that interfere with participation in an on-site, group-administered activity
